snippet: The operators of Madison Square Garden are asking for a permit in perpetuity, a plan that could seal Penn Station’s fate underground.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman asserts that New York City Council should deny request by owners of Madison Square Garden to renew in perpetuity permit that allows them to operate arena atop Penn Station; argues that license, if granted, will enshrine one of world's ugliest arenas and trap major transit hub underground with no practical way to lighten or open up its space.
lead_paragraph: The operators of Madison Square Garden are asking for a permit in perpetuity, a plan that could seal Penn Station’s fate underground.

headline.seo: Madison Square Garden’s Permit Is Up for Renewal
headline.main: Remember, City Council, Forever Is a Really Long Time
headline.print_headline: Remember, City Council, Forever Is a Really Long Time
